triples.name: Aerial robotics
triples.relevance: The core subject of the survey, covering the design and control of robots that operate in aerial environments.

triples.name: Helicopter
triples.relevance: One of the main platform types discussed as a form of aerial robotic manipulator with rotorcraft design.

triples.name: Multirotor
triples.relevance: Conventional underactuated multirotors are analyzed as primary platforms for aerial manipulation systems.

triples.name: Robotic arm
triples.relevance: The manipulator component attached to aerial platforms for physical interaction with the environment.

triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: The foundational platform technology for autonomous aerial robotic systems discussed throughout the survey.

triples.name: Teleoperation
triples.relevance: A key operational methodology enabling remote control and monitoring of aerial manipulators in complex tasks.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Planning algorithms are essential for autonomous path generation and collision avoidance in aerial manipulation.

triples.name: Computer vision
triples.relevance: Perception techniques for vision-based sensing, object detection, and environmental understanding by aerial robots.
